title: How Solar Irrigation Systems Work: Save Water & Power Your Farm Sustainably!

tasks.task: Install and operate a solar irrigation system.
subtasks: Position solar panels to capture sunlight.
Connect solar panels to a battery or grid for energy storage.
Install a water source (e.g., well, lake, river).
Set up a pump to draw water from the source.
Connect the pump to a specialized control system.
Choose the appropriate irrigation system (e.g., drip, sprinkler, submersible) based on crop type and needs.
Configure the irrigation system to deliver water efficiently to the crops.
Regularly clean solar panels to ensure optimal sunlight absorption.
Check and replace batteries or charge as needed.
Monitor the pump and control system for malfunctions.
Adjust irrigation settings as needed based on weather and crops' water requirements.

tasks.task: Evaluate and optimize the solar irrigation system for cost savings and sustainability.
subtasks: Assess energy consumption and cost savings from solar power.
Compare and contrast different irrigation methods (e.g., drip vs. sprinkler) for water efficiency and yield.
Research and consider water sources and pump types suitable for the local environment.
